intro: Planchonella pallida, commonly known as the pale planchonella, is a small to medium-sized tree native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by edible, round fruits that are typically yellow when ripe. Its bark and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
